column1: length at off stump, defended into the off side

huge appeal from Mitch for lbw. Full ball catches Lynn in front of leg stump. Rohit says no bat to Mitch as they consider the review. He is wrong, that is a big edge. It's also pitched outside leg. They don't end up taking the review though, so it's all good in the end. Lynn just jabbing at this in front of the body
full and just outside off, driven sweetly to extra cover's right. He dives and parries it towards mid-off
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right
length outside off, mistimed drive to cover
length on middle stump, tapped to mid-on
length outside off, leans into the drive, finds extra cover
length on off, punched down the ground to long-off
full on middle stump, drives down the pitch to Krunal
short of a length at off stump, makes room and punches to extra cover
full and fast, wide outside off. Chops at it and misses
full at leg stump, steps out and taps it to long-off
full at leg stump, jammed out to mid-on
slower ball at a length on middle stump, leans in and clips to midwicket
full slower ball outside off, looks to slog this and gets a thick inside edge towards deep square
full slower ball on leg stump this time. Looks to slug it into the leg side, gets a deflection off the pad into the off
slower ball, short of a length on middle stump. Pulled off the front foot but Krunal cleans up to his right at deep square
connects! Slower ball at a length on leg stump. Clears the front leg and slogs with the full flow to get it over the midwicket boundary
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square's right
length on middle stump, flicked to long-on
smokes it between point and cover. Whew. Gets his shoulders into this and no one moves. Slower ball, skidding on from a length with a lot of width. He chops at it so hard. What power.
short ball slanted across the corridor, arches back to let it go
clears the long leg boundary! Lynn slightly off balance at the second consecutive short ball, but he's held his shape in the end and lifted this from his chest off the top edge of the bat
full slower ball on off stump, tapped into the covers
length on off stump, gets on the back foot and drops this into the off side with soft hands
mistimed drive and Pollard can sprint behind this from mid-off and keep it in. Full toss outside off and it came off the toe-end. Looked like he was a little too eager to get that away
slipped out of his hand and chopped over point. It's an attempted offcutter and it ends up a juicy full toss at chest height with lots of width
short of a length just outside off, backs away and slaps it on the rise to Pollard at mid-off. It's quick and Pollard fumbles
full at off stump, opens the face and drives to cover point off the toe-end
length in the corridor defended into the off side
length and slanted in at off stump. Cramped on the drive. Can only get it into the off side with no timing
short of a length outside off, cut into the off side
straight over the bowler. Length ball skids on at off stump, not a lot of turn on that. Clears the front leg and slams through the line to clear the sight screen
length, skidding through again. Looks to go the same way but gets this attempted loft off the inside half and it trickles back harmlessly to the bowler
makes room and goes inside-out! What quick hands. And what powerful ones. Full on middle stump, exposes the stumps and drills it over the wide long-off region
short of a length at middle stump, makes room and taps into the covers
length on leg stump, flicked to square leg

that looks plumb. It's given. And Lynn tells Gill that's not worth the review. Hardik starts with a slower ball that floats up full and at middle stump. Gill doesn't pick and is beaten as he looks to flick this. Caught dead in front of middle
short of a length just outside off, looks to play the cut, beaten by the extra bounce
length outside off, leans in, opens the face and gets it down to third man
inside edge as he looks to cut this short ball outside off. Past the stumps and rolls out towards short fine
short and just outside off, cut straight to sweeper cover
short and wide outside off. Looks to cut and is beaten
yorker at leg stump, can't do more than push that down the pitch
full and wide outside off, makes room, drives to sweeper cover
length at middle stump, gets deep in the crease and punches to sweeper cover
length outside off, looks to muscle this and loses his timing. Down to long-on off the inside half
length and angled at leg stump. Plants the front leg across for the ramp, but he won't get it past the inner circle. Off the glove and keeper cleans up
length at middle stump, hurriedly pushed to midwicket
slower short ball wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left

taken by QDK! Yet another slower ball from Hardik to get a KKR opener. This dips at a length outside off. He makes room and has an ugly heave at it. Not anywhere close to the ball and gets a top edge that QDK has to go backwards to gather. He does it with some comfort. The wheels have come off for KKR
length on off stump, defended to point
short of a length outside off, late cut down to third man
past the edge. Slams one in the corridor, just short of a length. Karthik defends inside the line as this fizzes past
length on off stump, defended on the front foot to point
length on leg stump, tossed up. Leans in and flicks to midwicket
arm ball at a length on leg stump. Tickles it to short fine's right
length ball down leg side, past the attempted flick
full on off stump, driven with the turn to extra cover
length and down leg side. Sweeps viciously at this. It skids off the face and finds short fine who is really fine
full on off, driven out to long-off
length outside off, opens the face and runs it to short third
Uthappa looks to run a length ball down to third man, but he's beaten on the outside edge. McCleneghan took the pace off that one
and now he's down the track, looking to thump another cutter at under 125km/h through the covers, but failing to put bat to ball
cracked hard to mid off, but Pollard is in that position and there's no run to be had. Another dot
four in a row! Uthappa sets himself for an uppercut at a slow, short cutter at 121km/h, but it's another play and a miss
five! Uthappa has really been backed into a corner here. Another gentle length delivery, in the corridor, but he looks to hit it rather too hard and touches only fresh air
it's a maiden as Uthappa looks to run another one down and is beaten yet again outside off. There's a touch of panic starting to set in ...
Krunal darts in a low full toss from around the stumps, but Karthik can't make much of it, sweeping out to deep backward square
another dot, and it's a full toss too, dipping in towards off stump to be driven down to long off
flicked off the toes into the leg side, just the one
Robbie looks for a big biff over the leg side, but the ball rushes on to him, beating the bat and hitting the pad
left alone outside off! Krunal pushes this through slightly wider of off stump, and Uthappa just lets it past
pushed down to long off for an ambled single that keeps him the strike
sweet relief! Robbie has finally got hold of one, smiting a full slower ball over long on for a pressure-relieving six
and he looks for the same again, but the ball takes a thick inside edge onto the pad and rolls to short fine for a single
Karthik looks to glance off his legs, but the ball zips in to hit him on the pad. It pitched well outside leg, Malinga continuing around the stumps

a leaping Krunal snaffles one! Malinga slung another full one in towards the pads, Karthik looking to flick him to midwicket but neither keeping it along the turf nor getting any real elevation in the shot. Krunal is in position at midwicket, inside the circle, and he times his leap just right to pluck the ball out of the air
dug in by Lasith, but it's misdirected down the leg side

there's an appeal, and it's given! Russell falls to the very first legitimate delivery he faces, and what was clearly a plan from Malinga has worked. He targeted Russell with another bumper from around the stumps, but this one was bang on target. Russell found himself in an awkward position, and he could neither get out of the way nor drop his hands quickly enough, the ball brushing the gloves on the way through to the keeper
another short one at just under 135km/h, and Rana does manage to drop his hands under this one as it fizzes through to de Kock
Bumrah's back, and he starts with a gem of a delivery just outside off that bursts off the track and past Uthappa's outside edge - yet another play-and-miss
he backs away to leg but Bumrah follows him, the ball jagging in off the track to beat a whip into the leg side and strike him on the thigh
another dot, Bumrah bending his back on a 137km/h bouncer that lifts rapidly past Uthappa's attempted pull shot, thudding into de Kock's gloves
runs, finally! Uthappa backs away to leg and slashes a length ball behind point, beating third man on his right

picked up into the stands! Uthappa is moving around a lot in the crease, and he goes really deep to this short ball, using the pace and the angle to lift it into the stands beyond deep backward square leg for a vital boundary
lifted elegantly over long off! The ball was in the slot, a long half volley just outside off, but Rana also struck it really well, holding his shape and letting the right elbow lead the shot
this one is a little more agricultural, Rana backing away to leg and hacking a full one over the covers. They hurry back for a second

over third man this time! Rana is all over the place in the crease, backing away to leg. Hardik follows him with a short one, but Rana shows excellent awareness with third man up, ramping the ball up and over the fielder. And in fact, he's hit it so well that the ball carries all the way for six
Hardik switches back to over the stumps, Rana shimmying into a leg glance. He doesn't get the best connection, but there's room enough for a quick single

Hardik takes some pace off this full one, outside off, Uthappa setting himself for an almighty heave into the leg side but playing too early at it and missing yet another one. 48 dot balls in the innings so far
a bottom-handed slog into the leg side bounces down to long on, it's just the single and he'll keep the strike
Malinga stays around the stumps, slinging down a very full ball that's dug out down the ground
Malinga switches to over the stumps for the left-hander, Rana slicing a low full toss outside off out to the cover sweeper, on the bounce
well bowled, right up to him at 137km/h, but Rana's execution is equally good as he waits deep in the crease and angles his blade to work the ball behind point for a single
Uthappa can't lay bat on this leg-stump yorker, but they pinch a single off his boot. There's a stifled appeal from Malinga, but it pitched outside leg
canny bowling, pace off the ball to finish the over, but Rana waits on it and dead-bats a quick single towards point
and he shoots one across Rana's bows, the left hander making some room but missing an attempted thrash into the off side
Rana walks across to the off side, glancing off his pads and out to deep square for a single
nicely bowled, Bumrah bustling in and delivering a waspish full ball aimed at the off stump. Uthappa does well to dig it out, and gets a single for his troubles
direct hit might have had him! Rana pushed this just to the left of Rohit in the cover, who swoops and shies, but it goes wide
flung down well wide of off stump, wide of the popping crease, but it's not a wide as Uthappa had wandered in that direction too, missing an airy drive

down the ground! There was almost more height than distance on this as Uthappa slugged a full toss straight over Bumrah's head. Pollard is lurking at long on, and positions himself early, but the ball has just enough on it to beat him
swatted over cow corner! KKR need these runs so desperately. Rana fetches a length delivery cleanly into the leg side, the ball sailing well back into the crowd

but now he's got to go! Rana was looking to smash everything, and he went very deep in the crease looking to smear this over long off. But the connection isn't enough to get the ball past Pollard, who trots in and holds a simple catch at long off
Malinga loses his radar, and this one is called wide
and this one is called wide for height now Malinga digging in a bouncer that balloons well over the batsman
fuller this time, and Uthappa swings past it as he looks to wallop this down the ground
nicely bowled, very full and Uthappa can only dig it out back to the bowler
Malinga continues around the stumps, angling a full one right across Uthappa, who flings his arms through a booming drive but can't put bat to ball. The struggle continues
very full once again, and Uthappa clubs it into the leg side for a single to keep the strike
and he pushes his first ball too far outside off, and it's called wide. McCleneghan reckons its a harsh call
well, this is almost an identical delivery, but the umpire lets this one pass. And now Uthappa is the unhappy one
McCleneghan sticks with the plan of attack, pushing this full and wide, but this is too far and a clear wide
Uthappa finds this one within his reach, spanking it down the ground - but it's just the single
slapped out through the covers, but it's off the toe end and just the one
McCleneghan gifts another wide, pushing the ball too far outside off as he looks to keep it out of Uthappa's striking zone
short, quick and Uthappa gets an awful connection on his attempted pull. But in the end, that's what saves him as the ball cannot even reach long on
Rinku almost swings himself off his feet trying to hammer this back-of-a-length ball over the leg side, but fails to put bat to ball
another heave to leg, but this time bat meets ball and they take a single off the bottom edge
very full and angled across Rinku, who aims for the proverbial 'Row M' but can only cue-end a single to long on
peach of a delivery! This is a fine slower ball from Bumrah, who takes his pace right down to the low 120s, Uthappa through his shot hours before the ball gets to him
an attempted heave into the leg side instead brings a single down to long off, Uthappa playing a little too early at another slower one
Rinku swings hard to leg and the ball takes the top edge, but it's such a poor connection that it doesn't reach long on, Hardik running in from the boundary

a leading edge, a simple catch! Uthappa trudges off, his misery over. The disappointment is writ large on his face as he walks off. It was another slower one, it takes the toe end, and Sharma holds a simple catch in the covers

and Rinku holes out off the last ball, aiming to end it with a maximum but getting more height than distance in the shot. Hardik and Pollard are down on the straight boundary, and it's Hardik who calls early and holds the catch
length outside off, defended into the off side
short of a length outside off, mistimed cut to backward point

just clears fine leg! QDK falls over into the off side as he gets underneath a short ball and hooks. His position means this ball is going to get more elevation than distance. But the distance to clear isn't too long here
short of a length outside off, punched through cover. Rinku pedals back from backward point and stops this. Haven't seen someone who comes this close to matching Warner on speed on the ground
short of a length outside off, looks to cut and is beaten
short of a length on leg stump, tucked off the hips to fine leg
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length outside off, defended into the off side
length at off stump, defended on the back foot
short and wide outside off, left alone
length on middle stump, punched on the rise to mid-on
short of a length outside off, defended to backward point off the back foot
short of a length on middle stump, pulled to deep square's left
length and wide outside off. Looks to drive on the up, gets it off the low part of the bat. But it's a no-ball because Warrier's hand has mistakenly knocked the stumps down as he jumped to deliver
yorker just outside off, mistimed drive to mid-off
length at leg stump, looks to flick and cops it on the pad
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length outside off, tapped into the off side with an open face
full on middle stump, driven to mid-on
short of a length just outside off, allows it to come on and opens the face late to run this past the keeper
short of a length outside off, run down to third man
pumps it over square leg! Short of a length on leg stump, stays still and simply swipes from down to up, in front of his thigh. Comfortably over the fielder
top edge and very fine. Short and slanting across towards his left shoulder. Slow on the hook this time but the ball sails safely over
short at middle stump, pulled in front of square this time. Not bothering to keep it down again
full outside off, reaches out and chops straight to backward point
short of a length outside off, swishes at it and gets it on the bounce to backward point
length on off stump, runs it to short third and reacts very late for the run. Would have been out if the throw had hit the stumps at the non-striker's end
under-edge rolls through to the keeper. Short of a length outside off, throws his hands at it and can't connect
length at middle stump, nudged to mid-off where Russell picks up the ball and lets rip a throw that nearly takes out De Kock. And then bumps into him in the follow through.
short of a length wide outside off, waits on it and spanks it over mid-on, flat-batted over Russell
slower full ball on middle stump, jammed down the pitch
short of a length and ripping away outside off. Looks for the late cut and is beaten
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on leg stump, backs away and pushes into the covers
short of a length and climbing sharply in the corridor as he backs away and tries to cut this. Beaten
length on middle stump, gets the reverse sweep right, but he finds backward point
length on leg stump, looks to sweep and gets it to short fine off the thigh

superb diving catch from Karthik. Keeps his head in the game as his ship sinks. Short ball at middle stump, looks to pull and gets yet another top edge. this goes towards Lynn at short fine, who moves away as Karthik runs backwards and stretches to his right to hold on, before sliding to arrest the momentum. Top class
short and wide outside off, chopped past point. Rohit doesn't let KKR build any momentum from the wicket. Nicely on top of the bounce and great connection
short at middle stump, gets on top of the bounce again, hooks along the floor to fine leg
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and can't get the late cut past slip
short and up at the helmet. Watches it closely and uses the pace to steer this to long leg's right
length outside off, poked to extra cover on the rise
length on middle and leg, defended into the leg side off the inside half
length on leg stump, comes on nice and slow. He gets low and paddles it fine as it turns
short of a length on leg stump, glanced through square leg off the back foot
length just outside off, punched to long-on off the back foot
length at off stump, tapped to extra cover off the back foot
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length at leg stump, clipped into the leg side
short of a length outside off, chopped on the bounce to backward point
short of a length outside off, chopped down to third man
length on off stump, tapped back to the bowler off the front foot
shot! Surya's magic wrists. Overpitched ball outside off, half a stride across and then he whips it past mid-on, without even leaning in. Just glorious.
short of a length outside off, stabs at it and is beaten
short of a length just outside off, tapped to extra cover
full slower ball on leg stump, driven to long-on
short at leg stump, glanced down to fine leg
short ball outside off, gets on the front foot and slaps this to the midwicket boundary
bouncer outside off, looks to ramp it but that's too quick for him
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on middle stump, gets deep in the crease, allows it to come and punches off the back foot to beat midwicket to his right
short of a length on leg stump, punched to long-on's right off the back foot
short and wide outside off, slapped off the back foot through the vacant covers region
length on leg stump, flicked through square leg off the back foot
full and down leg side, looks for the paddle sweep, can't get bat on it
length at middle stump, looks to drive on the up, cops it on the pad as it breaks into him. Going down, half an appeal from DK
short of a length on off stump, defended to point
short ball outside off, pulled along the floor to deep square
length at off stump, flicked to midwicket
length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg
short of a length and down leg side, steered to fine leg with the angle
bouncer at middle stump, looks to hook and is beaten
mistimed from Rohit, who plays far too early and chips the ball over the leaping Warrier, mid off scooting around to cut it off
speared down the leg side, the ball kissing Rohit's boot on the way down. But Dinesh Karthik pulls off an athletic stop, tumbling to his left, to save the bye
slapped hard out to the cover sweeper, and they're back for the second
thumped into the leg side this time, but Rinku charges around the boundary at deep midwicket and parries the ball back into play, saving runs
and driven down the ground this time, Dre Russ sprinting across to stop the boundary
Warrier aims full, and Rohit digs it out down the ground to raise the fifty stand
deposited into the stands! It was lobbed up and straight by Narine, and Yadav held nothing back as he heaved into the leg side. Excellent connection, and it goes all the way
flicked with the turn into the leg side, turning the strike over
Narine zones in on an off stump line, Rohit leaning forward to defend
Rohit's down the track this time, but Narine spot him coming and pulls his length ball, the ball spinning in to hit his thigh pad

a thundering pull brings four! This wasn't all that short, but Rohit read the length really early, hopping back to get himself into position and then cracking the ball hard and into the gap between long on and deep midwicket

pitched right up by Gurney, and Yadav flicks into the leg side. This should have been a dot ball, but Lynn lets it through his legs at midwicket inside the circle, and it's only another athletic effort from Rinku at the boundary that saves the boundary
and Yadav immediately times a sumptuous drive right past him! It was full, on his legs, and Yadav timed a checked drive to perfection
fifty up for Rohit, and he gets there with a backfoot punch out to the sweeper
Gurney comes around the stumps and delivers a short ball without much vim, Yadav leaning back and threading a powerful pull through the gap on the leg side to take Mumbai to the brink
eased down the ground, and he'll keep the strike for what could be the last over
and he starts with a zippy yorker at just over 140km/h, but it's negotiated easily enough, being dug out past point for a single
Rohit makes a little room, but another rapid delivery rises up and over his attempted cut, thudding into the keeper's gloves
chipped cleanly over mid off! It was pitched up again and Rohit's eyes lit up as he checked a well-timed drive and sent the ball racing to the boundary
very full, just outside off, and Rohit angles his blade to direct his drive out to the sweeper
Prasidh digs this one in, Yadav ramping his uppercut over point ... but once again it's Rinku who sprints around and stops the boundary
and the match ends in a flash! Russell digs the ball in short, Yadav rocks back and lifts his hook shot up and over fine leg to end the game with just under four overs to spare
